items.title: Trump says he’s pulling National Guard out of Chicago, LA and Portland
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump announced Wednesday that he is pulling National Guard troops out of Chicago, Los Angeles and Portland, Oregon, for now. District judges and appeals courts have issued various rulings about the legality of the deployments. Last week, the U.S. Supreme Court refused to block a…
items.content: President Donald Trump announced Wednesday that he is pulling National Guard troops out of Chicago, Los Angeles and Portland, Oregon, for now. District judges and appeals courts have issued various rulings about the legality of the deployments. Last week, the U.S. Supreme Court refused to block a…

items.title: Trump backs away from deploying national guard in Los Angeles, Chicago and Portland
items.standfirst: Decision comes after DoJ stopped contesting California court’s ruling to return control of guard to state’s governorDonald Trump has staged a sudden climbdown from his attempts to impose federal troops in law enforcement roles on Democratic-run cities, announcing on Wednesday that he was ending attempted deployments from Los Angeles, Chicago and Portland.The unexpected shift came after justice department lawyers said they were no longer contesting a California court’s ruling that returned the national guard troops to the authority of Gavin Newsom, the state’s governor. It also followed a rare rebuke from the US supreme court, which blocked the White House’s efforts to deploy national guards in Illinois. Continue reading...
items.content: Decision comes after DoJ stopped contesting California court’s ruling to return control of guard to state’s governorDonald Trump has staged a sudden climbdown from his attempts to impose federal troops in law enforcement roles on Democratic-run cities, announcing on Wednesday that he was ending attempted deployments from Los Angeles, Chicago and Portland.The unexpected shift came after justice department lawyers said they were no longer contesting a California court’s ruling that returned the national guard troops to the authority of Gavin Newsom, the state’s governor. It also followed a rare rebuke from the US supreme court, which blocked the White House’s efforts to deploy national guards in Illinois. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump drops National Guard deployment plans in Los Angeles, Chicago and Portland
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump has stepped back from plans to deploy National Guard troops in several large, Democrat-led US cities, he announced on Wednesday. The decision underscores the legal and political limits he has faced in using the military to support his tough-on-crime agenda during his second term.
items.content: US President Donald Trump has stepped back from plans to deploy National Guard troops in several large, Democrat-led US cities, he announced on Wednesday. The decision underscores the legal and political limits he has faced in using the military to support his tough-on-crime agenda during his second term.

clusters.title: Finland seizes ship sailing from Russia after suspected cable sabotage
clusters.neutral_headline: Finland seizes ship sailing from Russia after suspected cable sabotage

items.title: Finland seizes ship sailing from Russia after suspected cable sabotage
items.standfirst: New telecommunications cable damage discovered in Finland's exclusive economic zone.
items.content: New telecommunications cable damage discovered in Finland's exclusive economic zone.

items.title: Finnish police seize vessel suspected of damaging underwater cable
items.standfirst: Border guards say they found ship with anchor lowered into sea after detection of fault in Helsinki-Tallinn telecoms link Finnish authorities have boarded and seized a cargo vessel sailing from Russia on suspicion of sabotaging two underwater telecommunications cables in the Baltic Sea, where a series of similar incidents have occurred in recent years.The vessel, the Fitburg, was on its way from St Petersburg to Haifa in Israel. Finnish coastguard officers boarded the ship at 11am, about six hours after disruption to the cables was first reported. Fourteen crew members, including several Russians, were taken into custody. Continue reading...
items.content: Border guards say they found ship with anchor lowered into sea after detection of fault in Helsinki-Tallinn telecoms link Finnish authorities have boarded and seized a cargo vessel sailing from Russia on suspicion of sabotaging two underwater telecommunications cables in the Baltic Sea, where a series of similar incidents have occurred in recent years.The vessel, the Fitburg, was on its way from St Petersburg to Haifa in Israel. Finnish coastguard officers boarded the ship at 11am, about six hours after disruption to the cables was first reported. Fourteen crew members, including several Russians, were taken into custody. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Jack Smith told House committee he had ‘proof beyond reasonable doubt’ in cases against Trump
clusters.neutral_headline: Transcript, video of Jack Smith's testimony on Trump cases released

items.title: Jack Smith told House committee he had ‘proof beyond reasonable doubt’ in cases against Trump
items.standfirst: Ex-special counsel testified in front of judiciary committee about aborted federal prosecution of Donald TrumpJack Smith, the former justice department special counsel who led the aborted federal prosecution of Donald Trump, told a congressional committee that he never spoke to Joe Biden about his cases, according to the transcript of a deposition released on Wednesday.In his behind-closed-doors testimony to the House judiciary committee earlier this month, Smith defended the charges he brought against Trump for allegedly possessing classified documents and attempting to overturn the 2020 election, while warning of the consequences of allowing election meddling to go unpunished. Continue reading...
items.content: Ex-special counsel testified in front of judiciary committee about aborted federal prosecution of Donald TrumpJack Smith, the former justice department special counsel who led the aborted federal prosecution of Donald Trump, told a congressional committee that he never spoke to Joe Biden about his cases, according to the transcript of a deposition released on Wednesday.In his behind-closed-doors testimony to the House judiciary committee earlier this month, Smith defended the charges he brought against Trump for allegedly possessing classified documents and attempting to overturn the 2020 election, while warning of the consequences of allowing election meddling to go unpunished. items.title: Court rules Trump administration must fund consumer finance watchdog
items.standfirst: A federal judge ruled on Tuesday that the Trump administration is legally required to secure funding for the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), and that failing to do so would violate a prior court order barring the government from dismantling or shutting down the agency. In the…
items.content: A federal judge ruled on Tuesday that the Trump administration is legally required to secure funding for the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), and that failing to do so would violate a prior court order barring the government from dismantling or shutting down the agency. In the…

items.title: Judge says Trump administration must continue funding consumer watchdog
items.standfirst: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is at risk after Donald Trump vowed to shutter it since his return to officeA federal judge has ordered that the Trump administration must allow funding for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) to continue.The watchdog, which supporters say protects US consumers from financial harm by powerful banks, lenders and corporations, is at risk of collapsing after Donald Trump vowed to shutter it since he returned to office this year. Continue reading...
items.content: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is at risk after Donald Trump vowed to shutter it since his return to officeA federal judge has ordered that the Trump administration must allow funding for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) to continue.The watchdog, which supporters say protects US consumers from financial harm by powerful banks, lenders and corporations, is at risk of collapsing after Donald Trump vowed to shutter it since he returned to office this year. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Oxfam, Doctors Without Borders slam Israel’s Gaza ban
clusters.neutral_headline: Oxfam, Doctors Without Borders slam Israel’s Gaza ban

items.title: Oxfam, Doctors Without Borders slam Israel’s Gaza ban
items.standfirst: Humanitarian organisations Oxfam and Doctors Without Borders are slamming Israel’s decision to ban them from Gaza.
items.content: Humanitarian organisations Oxfam and Doctors Without Borders are slamming Israel’s decision to ban them from Gaza.

items.title: Israel suspends 37 aid organisations from operating in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israel says it is suspending more than 30 humanitarian organisations, including Doctors Without Borders, from operating in Gaza for failing to comply with new registration rules.
items.content: Israel says it is suspending more than 30 humanitarian organisations, including Doctors Without Borders, from operating in Gaza for failing to comply with new registration rules.

clusters.title: Eurostar slowly resumes but passengers face more cancellations and delays
clusters.neutral_headline: Eurostar slowly resumes but passengers face more cancellations and delays

items.title: Eurostar slowly resumes but passengers face more cancellations and delays
items.standfirst: Passengers told to expect knock-on impacts after power supply problem and broken-down train halted services on TuesdayRail traffic through the Channel tunnel slowly resumed on Wednesday with more cancellations and delays after an electricity failure on Tuesday stranded thousands of passengers and trapped some for a night in a powerless train.Two London-Paris trains were cancelled and most trips were delayed in both directions as Eurostar warned of “knock-on impacts” on New Year’s Eve. Continue reading...
items.content: Passengers told to expect knock-on impacts after power supply problem and broken-down train halted services on TuesdayRail traffic through the Channel tunnel slowly resumed on Wednesday with more cancellations and delays after an electricity failure on Tuesday stranded thousands of passengers and trapped some for a night in a powerless train.Two London-Paris trains were cancelled and most trips were delayed in both directions as Eurostar warned of “knock-on impacts” on New Year’s Eve. Continue reading...

items.title: Eurostar to return to normal after massive power supply leaves travellers stranded
items.standfirst: A power failure in the Channel Tunnel suspended holiday plans for thousands of Eurostar passengers on Tuesday, after services between London and the continent were suspended for hours. Although train services were slowly returning to normal by Tuesday evening, many passengers had already postponed the plans at a peak time for travel. Details by Andrew Hilliar and Ludovic de Foucaud.
items.content: A power failure in the Channel Tunnel suspended holiday plans for thousands of Eurostar passengers on Tuesday, after services between London and the continent were suspended for hours. Although train services were slowly returning to normal by Tuesday evening, many passengers had already postponed the plans at a peak time for travel. Details by Andrew Hilliar and Ludovic de Foucaud.

clusters.title: Search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 resumes
clusters.neutral_headline: Search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 resumes

items.title: Search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 resumes
items.standfirst: The deep-sea search for missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 has begun - more than a decade after the jet vanished with 239 people on board.
items.content: The deep-sea search for missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 has begun - more than a decade after the jet vanished with 239 people on board.

items.title: Search for missing Malaysia Airlines flight resumes, reviving hope of answers after more than a decade
items.standfirst: The search for the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 is set to resume Tuesday, more than a decade after the plane went missing with 239 people onboard in one of the world’s greatest aviation mysteries.
items.content: The search for the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 is set to resume Tuesday, more than a decade after the plane went missing with 239 people onboard in one of the world’s greatest aviation mysteries.
